strategy: Replace the Gaussian Mixture Model with a self-supervised autoencoder trained on the MountainCarContinuous state space to learn latent representations. The autoencoder compresses the (position, velocity) state into a low-dimensional latent space, which is then used as the input to the PPO agent. The encoder acts as a feature extractor, enabling the agent to learn more compact and invariant representations that generalize better across different driving scenarios. This approach shifts from clustering-based semantics to continuous, denoising feature learning, improving exploration and policy stability in high-dimensional and non-linear state spaces.

"""
Copyright (c) Meta Platforms, Inc. and affiliates.
Adapted from https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax-blines and https://github.com/RobertTLange/gymnax
"""
import flax.linen as nn
import gymnax
import jax
import jax.numpy as jnp
from tensorflow_probability.substrates import jax as tfp
def get_model_ready(rng, config):
    """Instantiate a model according to obs shape of environment."""
    # Get number of desired output units
    env, env_params = gymnax.make("MountainCarContinuous-v0")
    model = Model(
        **config.network_config, num_output_units=env.num_actions
    )
    # Initialize the network based on the observation shape
    obs_shape = env.observation_space(env_params).shape
    params = model.init(rng, jnp.zeros(obs_shape), rng=rng)
    return model, params
def default_mlp_init(scale=0.05):
    return nn.initializers.uniform(scale)
# DO NOT CHANGE THE NAME OF THIS CLASS. YOUR EVALUATION WILL FAIL.
class Model(nn.Module):
    """Split Actor-Critic Architecture for PPO."""
    num_output_units: int
    num_hidden_units: int
    num_hidden_layers: int
    prefix_actor: str = "actor"
    prefix_critic: str = "critic"
    min_std: float = 0.001
    model_name: str = "separate-mlp"
    @nn.compact
    def __call__(self, x, rng):
        x_v = nn.relu(
            nn.Dense(
                self.num_hidden_units,
                name=self.prefix_critic + "_fc_1",
                bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
            )(x)
        )
        # Loop over rest of intermediate hidden layers
        for i in range(1, self.num_hidden_layers):
            x_v = nn.relu(
                nn.Dense(
                    self.num_hidden_units,
                    name=self.prefix_critic + f"_fc_{i+1}",
                    bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
                )(x_v)
            )
        v = nn.Dense(
            1,
            name=self.prefix_critic + "_fc_v",
            bias_init=default_mlp_init(),
        )(x_v)

            nn.

actions.action: python -c "with open('src/networks.py', 'w') as f: f.write('class AutoEncoder(nn.Module):\\n    latent_dim: int = 16\\n    @nn.compact\\n    def __call__(self, x):\\n        x = nn.relu(nn.Dense(64)(x))\\n        x = nn.relu(nn.Dense(32)(x))\\n        return nn.Dense(self.latent_dim)(x)\\n\\nclass Model(nn.Module):\\n    num_output_units: int\\n    num_hidden_units: int\\n    num_hidden_layers: int\\n    prefix_actor: str = \"actor\"\\n    prefix_critic: str = \"critic\"\\n    min_std: float = 0.001\\n    model_name: str = \"separate-mlp\"\\n\\n    @nn.compact\\n    def __call__(self, x, rng):\\n        # First, pass through the encoder to get latent representation\\n        encoder = AutoEncoder(latent_dim=self.num_hidden_units)\\n        z = encoder(x)\\n\\n        # Now use the latent representation for actor and critic\\n        x_v = nn.relu(nn.Dense(self.num_hidden_units, name=self.prefix_critic + \"_fc_1\")(z))\\n        for i in range(1, self.num_hidden_layers):\\n            x_v = nn.relu(nn.Dense(self.num_hidden_units, name=self.prefix_critic + f\"_fc_{i+1}\")(x_v))\\n        v = nn.Dense(1, name=self.prefix_critic + \"_fc_v\")(x_v)\\n\\n        x_a = nn.relu(nn.Dense(self.num_hidden_units, name=self.prefix_actor + \"_fc_1\")(z))\\n        for i in range(1, self.num_hidden_layers):\\n            x_a = nn.relu(nn.Dense(self.num_hidden_units, name=self.prefix_actor + f\"_fc_{i+1}\")(x_a))\\n        mu = nn.Dense(self.num_output_units, name=self.prefix_actor + \"_fc_mu\")(x_a)\\n        log_scale = nn.Dense(self.num_output_units, name=self.prefix_actor + \"_fc_scale\")(x_a)\\n        scale = jax.nn.softplus(log_scale) + self.min_std\\n        pi = tfp.distributions.MultivariateNormalDiag(mu, scale)\\n        return v, pi')"
